Title:
Paracoccidioides lutzii sp. nov., biological and clinical
implications.
Keywords:
Paracoccidioides lutzii, Paracoccidioides brasiliensis,
Paracoccidioidomycosis Speciation
Abstract:
Paracoccidioides lutzii, formerly known as âPb01-like
strainsâ in the P. brasiliensis complex, is proposed as a new species
based on phylogenetic and comparative genomics data, recombination
analysis, and morphological characteristics. P. lutzii occurs in the
central and northern regions of Brazil. Conidia of P. lutzii are
elongate differing from those of P. brasiliensis. Studies between P.
brasiliensis and P. lutzii may have significant clinical consequences of
the diagnosis and therapeutics of paracoccidioidomycosis.
